SEARCH
Package model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
The Game class represents a game instance (MODEL). It implements the Serializable interface to support serialization and deserialization.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int id, Dashboard dashboard, List<Player> pl, int numberOfPlayers)
      Constructs a new Game instance with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - the number of the game.
      dashboard - the reference to the dashboard.
      pl - the list of players.
      numberOfPlayers - the number of players in the game.

  • Method Details

    • updateDashboard

      public void updateDashboard(List<Integer> xCord, List<Integer> yCord) throws Exception
      Updates the dashboard by setting the specified tiles at the given coordinates to BLANK.
      Parameters:
      xCord - the list of x-coordinates of the tiles to be updated.
      yCord - the list of y-coordinates of the tiles to be updated.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error during the update process or if the dashboard needs to be refilled.

    • addTiles

      public void addTiles(Shelf shelfToModify, Tile[] tilesPicked, int column)
      Adds the specified tiles to the given shelf at the specified column.
      Parameters:
      shelfToModify - the shelf to modify.
      tilesPicked - the tiles to be added to the shelf.
      column - the column at which the tiles should be added.

    • getDashboard

      public Dashboard getDashboard()
      Returns the dashboard object associated with the game.
      Returns:
      the dashboard object.

    • getDashboardMatrix

      public Tile[][] getDashboardMatrix()
      Returns the matrix representation of the dashboard.
      Returns:
      the matrix representation of the dashboard.

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()
      Returns the list of players participating in the game.
      Returns:
      the list of players.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns the current player in the game.
      Returns:
      the current player.

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer(Player pl)
      Sets the current player in the game.
      Parameters:
      pl - the player to set as the current player.

    • getCommonGoals

      public List<CommonGoals> getCommonGoals()
      Returns the list of common goals in the game.
      Returns:
      the list of common goals.

    • setCommonGoals

      public void setCommonGoals()
      Sets the common goals for the game. Two random common goals are selected from the available options and assigned to the game. The common goals determine the objectives that players aim to achieve during the game.

    • getEndGame

      public boolean getEndGame()
      Retrieves the status of the end game flag.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, false otherwise.

    • setEndGameTrue

      public void setEndGameTrue()
      Sets the end game flag to true. This indicates that the game has ended.
